greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime dividing n is a(n)-th prime (a(1)=0).
comment: Grundy numbers of the game in which you decrease n by a number prime to n, and the game ends when 1 is reached. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Jul 21 2013

a(n) = the smallest part of the partition having Heinz number n. We define the Heinz number of a partition p = [p_1, p_2, ..., p_r] as Product(p_j-th prime, j=1...r) (concept used by _Alois P. Heinz_ in A215366 as an "encoding" of a partition). For example, for the partition [1, 1, 2, 4, 10] we get 2*2*3*7*29 = 2436. Example: a(21) = 2; indeed, the partition having Heinz number 21 = 3*7 is [2,4]. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 04 2015
a(n) is the number of numbers whose largest proper divisor is n, i.e., for n>1, number of occurrences of n in A032742. - _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 04 2016
For n > 1, a(n) gives the number of row where n occurs in arrays A083221 and A246278. - _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 07 2017
reference: John H. Conway, On Numbers and Games, 2nd Edition, p. 129.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Douglas E. Iannucci and Urban Larsson, Game values of arithmetic functions, arXiv:2101.07608 [math.NT], 2021.
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
example: a(15) = 2 because 15=3*5, 3<5 and 3 is the 2nd prime.
mathematica: a[1] = 0; a[n_] := PrimePi[ FactorInteger[n][[1, 1]] ]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 96}](* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 11 2012 *)
program: from sympy import primepi, isprime, primefactors
def a(n): return 0 if n==1 else a049084(min(primefactors(n))) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 05 2017
xref: Cf. also A078898, A246277, A250469 and arrays A083221 and A246278.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 15 2000
